name: Social Web App
description: A social web app for real-time content sharing and community interaction.

current_prd.elevator_pitch: Our social web app provides a dynamic platform for users to connect, share content, and engage in real-time interactions. We solve the need for an intuitive and personalized social experience, offering seamless content posting, following, and real-time updates, all managed through a comprehensive admin dashboard.
current_prd.problem_statement: Many existing social platforms lack seamless real-time interaction, personalized content feeds, and comprehensive administrative tools for content and user management, leading to fragmented user experiences and moderation challenges.
current_prd.solution: The social web app will provide a robust platform with real-time features for posting, liking, and commenting, a personalized user feed based on follows, and a powerful admin dashboard for content and user moderation, ensuring a dynamic and safe user experience.

key_features.feature_description: Enable user signup and login via email/password and social authentication (e.g., Google, Facebook).
Allow users to manage their profile information, including bio, avatar, and account settings.
Display a feed of posts from followed users and public content, with infinite scroll functionality.
Enable users to create and publish text-based posts and upload images.
Allow users to like and comment on posts in real-time without page reloads.
Enable users to follow and unfollow other users, customizing their content timeline.
A backend interface for administrators to moderate user-generated content, manage user accounts, and view platform analytics.

steps: User navigates to the app's login/signup page.
User chooses to sign up with email or a social provider.
If email: User enters email and password, then confirms email.
If social: User authenticates via chosen social provider.
System creates/authenticates user session and redirects to user feed.
User navigates to their profile page.
User clicks 'Edit Profile'.
User updates bio, avatar, or account settings.
User clicks 'Save Changes'.
System updates user profile and displays confirmation.
User clicks 'Create Post' button.
User enters text and/or uploads an image.
User clicks 'Post'.
System publishes the post and displays it in the user's feed and followers' feeds in real-time.
User views a post in their feed.
User clicks the 'Like' icon.
System registers the like and updates the like count in real-time without page reload.
User views a post in their feed.
User clicks the 'Comment' icon.
User types their comment in the input field.
User clicks 'Submit'.
System publishes the comment and displays it under the post in real-time without page reload.
User navigates to another user's profile.
User clicks 'Follow' or 'Unfollow' button.
System updates the follow status and adjusts the user's personalized feed accordingly.
Admin logs into the Admin Dashboard.
Admin navigates to the 'Content Management' section.
Admin reviews reported or flagged posts.
Admin can approve, edit, or delete content.
System updates content status and notifies relevant users if necessary.
Admin logs into the Admin Dashboard.
Admin navigates to the 'User Management' section.
Admin searches for specific users or browses the user list.
Admin can view user profiles, suspend accounts, or reset passwords.
System applies changes to user accounts and logs admin actions.
Admin logs into the Admin Dashboard.
Admin navigates to the 'Analytics' section.
Admin views dashboards displaying key metrics like active users, new registrations, content engagement, and moderation actions.
System provides real-time or near real-time data visualizations.

current_prd.success_metrics: Achieve 10,000 active users within the first 6 months. Maintain a user retention rate of 60% month-over-month. Achieve an average of 5 posts per active user per week. Ensure 99.9% uptime and real-time interaction latency under 200ms.
current_prd.competitors: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, TikTok, Reddit, Mastodon, Bluesky.
current_prd.vision: To become a leading social platform known for its seamless real-time interactions, personalized content delivery, and a strong, engaged community, fostering meaningful connections and diverse content sharing.

target_audience.name: Social Media Enthusiasts
target_audience.pain_points: Cluttered feeds, lack of genuine interaction, privacy concerns, overwhelming content volume, slow loading times.
target_audience.demographics: Ages 18-35, tech-savvy, active on multiple social platforms, diverse interests.
target_audience.needs_and_goals: Connect with friends and family, discover new content, express themselves creatively, stay updated on trends, real-time interaction.

target_audience.name: Content Creators & Influencers
target_audience.pain_points: Limited reach on existing platforms, complex analytics, difficulty engaging with followers, lack of direct monetization tools.
target_audience.demographics: Content creators, influencers, small businesses, ages 20-45, seeking audience engagement.
target_audience.needs_and_goals: Reach a wider audience, monetize content, build a community, track engagement metrics, easy content publishing.

phasing.rationale: This phase establishes the fundamental building blocks of the social app. Users can register, create a profile, publish content, and view a basic stream of posts. This is a launch-able MVP that allows for initial user acquisition and feedback on the core content sharing experience.

This phase significantly enhances the social aspect of the platform. Users can now personalize their content feed by following others and engage with posts in real-time. This makes the platform much more dynamic and interactive, ready for a broader launch or a compelling demo showcasing core social features.

This phase introduces the necessary tools for platform administrators to manage user-generated content, moderate users, and gain insights into platform activity. While not a direct user-facing feature, it's crucial for maintaining a safe and well-managed environment, making the platform ready for a more controlled beta launch or a comprehensive stakeholder demo.

current_prd.design_principles:
User-Centricity: Prioritize user needs and intuitive interactions.
Real-time Responsiveness: Ensure immediate feedback for all user actions (posting, liking, commenting).
Simplicity & Intuition: Design a clean, uncluttered interface that is easy to navigate for all users.
Personalization: Offer customizable experiences, especially in content feeds based on user preferences and follows.
Accessibility: Design for inclusivity, ensuring the platform is usable by individuals with diverse abilities.
Consistency: Maintain a unified design language across all features and platforms for a cohesive experience.

planned.model_content:
class Post < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :author, class_name: 'User'
  belongs_to :organization
  has_many :likes, dependent: :destroy
  has_many :comments, dependent: :destroy

  rhino_owner :organization
  rhino_references [:author, :organization]
end
planned.migration_content:
class CreatePosts < ActiveRecord::Migration[7.2]
  def change
    create_table :posts do |t|
      t.text :content
      t.string :image_url

      t.references :author, null: false, foreign_key: { to_table: :users }
      t.references :organization, null: false, foreign_key: true

      t.timestamps
    end
  end
end
planned.rails_model_generation_command_line: rails generate model Post author:references organization:references content:text image_url:string
